item.title: Bandit Algos for Estimation, Hypothesis Testing, and Decision Making
item.description: TODO: redo in Python, make an agent that uses each strategy as a method. Build the agent throughout the script. Bandit Algorithms Much of this is from this blog. Here I evaluate different algorithms for bandit problems similar to those anticipated in industry or testing settings. Criteria of consideration are; Problem Formalization Bandit tasks can be cast as a Markov Decision Process. \[ \begin{aligned} t &\in \{1,...,T\} \\ a_t &\in \mathcal{A} \\ s_t &\in \mathcal{S} \\ r_t &= R(s_{t+1}|a_t,s_t) = v(s_{t+1}|a_t,s_t) \\ T(s_{t+1}|a_t,s_t) &= p(s_{t+1}|a_t,s_t) \\ \pi(s_t)&=p(a_t|s_t) \end{aligned} \]

item.title: Introduction to Metrics Through YouTube Creator
item.description: What are Metrics? Metrics are how the data scientist communicates with project managers. Two categories; success and tracking. Goals are defined in terms of metrics, and user experience is understood through metrics. Success Metrics Tracking Metrics Metrics for Goals Metrics for Insights Communicating Metrics Idea from: Add metrics from google analytics, and youtube creator.

item.title: Probability and Information
item.description: Probability Theory and Information Theory Types of Probabilities and Their Computations motivation? Many important variables (future income, GDP, who I’ll marry, whether I’ll get sick, what disease I have given some symptoms, …) Randomness, Event Spaces, and Probability motivating example.. Imagine that a vaccine against a dangerous disease recently becomes available. However, there is a small risk that the vaccine will produce a condition just as bad as the disease itself.

item.title: Recommending: Searching, Sorting, Ranking
item.description: Recommendation Sort Algorithms Search Algorithms Ranking Algorithms Recommendation Lots of recommendation algorithms Data science methods play a major role in discovering recommendations for users. Econ, compliments and substitutes (competitors). Types of recommendation; compliments (these go together), competitors (you might also like…), temporal (might buy this again in the future). Horizontal and vertical focus Temporal involves forecasting, which is a topic for another post. Sort Algorithms Lots of sort algorithms

item.title: Why I Like Bayesian Statistics
item.description: Overview Coherent Flexible Integration with decision theory Overview Madean autoclicker to play cookie clicker… Coherent Examples where frequentist stats is incoherent? Flexible easy to model complex processes easy to test non-standard hypotheses, e.g. “does every”, or “two groups higher, one group lower” Integration with decision theory Thompson sampling example
